io.spine.server.entity.storage

Interface ColumnType<J,S,R,C>

  • Type Parameters:
    J - the Java type represented by the column
    S - the "store as" type of the column
    R - the type of the record in the database, which holds a single cortege of data and is consumed by the database upon write
    C - the type of the column identifier in the R
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleColumnType

    @SPI
public interface ColumnType<J,S,R,C>
    An interface for handling type conversion for the entity columns.

    When retrieved from an instance of an Entity, the EntityColumn may be of an inappropriate type for storing. To convert the value into an appropriate type, use ColumnType.convertColumnValue(J).

    After the conversion, you might want to save the value into a special storage specific DTO, which commonly is built in a key-value fashion. To do that, call ColumnType.setColumnValue(R, S, C) and pass both the DTO to store the value to and the key to store it under.

    Example of implementing this interface for a JDBC-based storage: 

         
     class VarcharDateType implements ColumnType&lt;Date, String, PreparedStatement, Integer&gt; {
         \@Override
         public String convertColumnValue(Date fieldValue) {
             return MY_DATE_FORMAT.format(fieldValue);
         }
            \@Override
         public void setColumnValue(PreparedStatement record, String value, Integer column) {
             record.setString(column, value);
         }
            \@Override
         public void setNull(PreparedStatement storageRecord, Integer columnIdentifier) {
             storageRecord.setNull(columnIdentifier, Types.VARCHAR);
         }
     }

    The example above translates a Date into a formatted String, which is persisted into the DB.

    It's necessary to make these operations atomic to allow automatic type conversion when performing the DB queries.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      S convertColumnValue(J fieldValue)
      Converts the EntityColumn specified in the Entity declaration to the type in which the Field is stored.
      void setColumnValue(R storageRecord, S value, C columnIdentifier)
      Set the EntityColumn value to the database record type.
      void setNull(R storageRecord, C columnIdentifier)
      Sets the null value to the EntityColumn.

    • Method Detail

      • convertColumnValue

        S convertColumnValue(J fieldValue)
        Converts the EntityColumn specified in the Entity declaration to the type in which the Field is stored.

        Common example is converting com.google.protobuf.Timestamp into java.util.Date.

        Parameters:
        fieldValue - the EntityColumn of the initial type
        Returns:
        the EntityColumn of the "store as" type

      • setColumnValue

        void setColumnValue(R storageRecord,
                    S value,
                    C columnIdentifier)
        Set the EntityColumn value to the database record type.

        Common example is setting a value to a java.sql.PreparedStatement instance into a determined position.

        Parameters:
        storageRecord - the database record
        value - the value to store
        columnIdentifier - the identifier of the column, e.g. its index
        See Also:
        ColumnType.setNull(Object, Object)

      • setNull

        void setNull(R storageRecord,
             C columnIdentifier)
        Sets the null value to the EntityColumn.

        Used if the actual value of the EntityColumn, defined for storing, is null.

        Parameters:
        storageRecord - the database record
        columnIdentifier - the identifier of the column, e.g. its index
        See Also:
        ColumnType.setColumnValue(Object, Object, Object)
